meanings.definition: The act of intruding or the state of being intruded.
meanings.sent1: The intrusion of the noisy neighbor disrupted the peaceful atmosphere.
meanings.sent2: The security system detected an intrusion into the building after hours.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel's intrusion into the picnic caused quite a commotion.
meanings.sent4: The intrusion of sunlight through the window felt like a warm embrace.
meanings.sent5: The sudden intrusion of a loud noise made everyone jump.

meanings.sent1: The unexpected intrusion of a telemarketer during dinner annoyed the family.
meanings.sent2: The cybersecurity team worked tirelessly to prevent any intrusion into the network.
meanings.sent3: The intrusion of a fly buzzing around the room was a minor inconvenience.
meanings.sent4: The intrusion of dark clouds signaled an impending storm.
meanings.sent5: The intrusion of bad news dampened the mood of the party.

meanings.definition: The action of forcing oneself into a situation or place where one is not welcome or invited.
meanings.sent1: The intrusion of the uninvited guest caused tension among the hosts.
meanings.sent2: The company had strict policies to prevent any intrusion into confidential meetings.
meanings.sent3: The intrusion of a cat into the dog park led to some unexpected chaos.
meanings.sent4: The intrusion of doubt into her mind clouded her judgment.
meanings.sent5: The intrusion of a stranger into their conversation made them uneasy.
